sentences.text: Bug to track Firefox 8 and friends, USN information will go here after release.
Packages are building in ppa:ubuntu-mozilla-security/ppa and should be ready for testing in a few hours.
I installed Firefox 8 in Oneiric from the mentioned PPA, it worked except one bug: Google search via search bar suddenly delivered english results instead of german (which is my locale)!
I could fix this by  the "Manage seach engines...
This bug was fixed in the package ubufox - 0.9.2-0ubuntu0.11.04.2
* Move ubufox in to the Firefox application directory (LP: #887339)
This bug was fixed in the package ubufox - 1.0-0ubuntu2.1
* Move ubufox in to the Firefox application directory (LP: #887339)
This bug was fixed in the package firefox - 8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.11.10.3
* New upstream release from the stable channel (FIREFOX_8_0_BUILD1)
* Don't disable our bundled addons on upgrade
* Modify the UA string to add "Ubuntu" to the platform component
* Shrink the default mozconfig right down so that we use mostly upstream     defaults, rather than overriding them with our own options.
It is still     possible to override them though.
We also drop the pkg-config checks in     debian/rules which allowed a fallback build configuration when dependencies     aren't satisfied.
Really, the build should just fail here rather than     continuing in some undesirable fallback mode
* Refresh build-depends, as this hasn't been done for a while:
- Drop patchutils, libxft-dev, libxinerama-dev, libgnome2-dev and bzip2.       These aren't needed
- Drop liborbit2-dev - only required if there is no libidl
- Add libglib2.0-dev, libext-dev, libfontconfig1-dev and libpango1.0-dev,       as the configure script checks for these directly
- Add minimum versions to libgconf2-dev, libgnomevfs2-dev, yasm and       libgnomeui-dev
- Specify minimum versions for libnspr4-dev, libcairo2-dev, libsqlite3-dev       and libnss3-dev when using system versions of those libs
* Introduce a branch config file (debian/config/branch.mk) which holds     settings which shouldn't be merged between branches (eg, whether     the crash reporter should be enabled)
* Don't open about:blank from the New Window quicklist entry
* Touch debian/control.in during clean to force a refresh of debian/control,     so we can check if it is out-of-date and fail if it is
* Drop the mozilla-devscripts dependency. We were only using this for creating     tarballs anyway. Instead, implement our own get-orig-source target, which
also fixes some problems we were having
* Lots of workflow improvements for dealing with language packs:
* Fix LP: #887435 - Backport patch from aurora to correctly handle EOF in     js::TokenStream::getAtSourceMappingURL on platforms with unsigned chars
* Turn off the one-time addon selection dialog (LP: #888307)
* Fix LP: #758111 - update ubuntulinux.org bookmark - thanks to Jonathan     Rothwell for the patch
This bug was fixed in the package firefox - 8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.11.04.3
* Don't disable our bundled addons on upgrade
* Modify the UA string to add "Ubuntu" to the platform component
* Shrink the default mozconfig right down so that we use mostly upstream     defaults, rather than overriding them with our own options.
It is still     possible to override them though.
We also drop the pkg-config checks in     debian/rules which allowed a fallback build configuration when dependencies     aren't satisfied.
Really, the build should just fail here rather than     continuing in some undesirable fallback mode
* Refresh build-depends, as this hasn't been done for a while:
- Drop patchutils, libxft-dev, libxinerama-dev, libgnome2-dev and bzip2.       These aren't needed
- Drop liborbit2-dev - only required if there is no libidl
- Add libglib2.0-dev, libext-dev, libfontconfig1-dev and libpango1.0-dev,       as the configure script checks for these directly
- Add minimum versions to libgconf2-dev, libgnomevfs2-dev, yasm and       libgnomeui-dev
- Specify minimum versions for libnspr4-dev, libcairo2-dev, libsqlite3-dev       and libnss3-dev when using system versions of those libs
* Introduce a branch config file (debian/config/branch.mk) which holds     settings which shouldn't be merged between branches (eg, whether     the crash reporter should be enabled)
* Don't open about:blank from the New Window quicklist entry
* Touch debian/control.in during clean to force a refresh of debian/control,     so we can check if it is out-of-date and fail if it is
* Drop the mozilla-devscripts dependency. We were only using this for creating     tarballs anyway. Instead, implement our own get-orig-source target, which
also fixes some problems we were having
* Lots of workflow improvements for dealing with language packs:
* Fix LP: #887435 - Backport patch from aurora to correctly handle EOF in     js::TokenStream::getAtSourceMappingURL on platforms with unsigned chars
* Turn off the one-time addon selection dialog (LP: #888307)
* Fix LP: #758111 - update ubuntulinux.org bookmark - thanks to Jonathan     Rothwell for the patch
This bug was fixed in the package mozvoikko - 1.10.0-0ubuntu0.11.04.3
This bug was fixed in the package mozvoikko - 1.10.0-0ubuntu2.1
Did you install the German language pack from the PPA as well?
Yes, the german language pack was also installed from the PPA.
Was the interface using the correct language?
Yes, everything else was localized correctly, only the search results  from google were suddenly English.
I remember vaguely that  I experienced the same behaviour this summer during a Firefox upgrade on  Natty from 4 to 5 or 5 to 6, so this might be an issue that is already  around for a longer time.
I'll check and report if this happens again when a new Firefox version  gets installed.
